concept.title: Running-in speeds
concept.shortdesc: Running-in refers to the first 500 miles (800 km) of running the engine of a new vehicle. During the initial period you shouldn't overly tax the engine.

conbody.p: The treatment given to the engine during this period has a bearing on its subsequent life. Therefore, you should limit the engine speed during this early period of your new vehicle's life.
conbody.note: Do not drive at full throttle in any gear.
Do not allow the engine to labour in any gear.
